column2: MISSOURI DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
Question Text
1. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column6: stop doing what they are doing.
column8: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column10: be ready to stop at the stop sign.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column8: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column10: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
4. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
5. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
6. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
7. A red traffic sign means?
8. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 9. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column6: The driver who does not control the car.

column2: 10. When driving in heavy traffic, you should:
column4: drive with the flow of traffic.
column6: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column10: drive faster than the flow of traffic.

column2: 11. A yellow signal light means:
column4: The car in front of you is going too slow
column6: The traffic signal is changing from green to red
column8: You should slam on your brakes

column2: 12. BAC is expressed in:
column10: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 13. A flashing yellow light means:
column6: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column8: The light will soon change from green to red.

column2: 14. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column8: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
column10: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.

column2: 15. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column6: Report aggressive drivers to law enforcement authorities.

column2: 16. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column6: wait until the red lights stop flashing.
column8: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 17. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: must always come to a complete stop.
column6: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column10: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.

column2: 18. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 19. If your gas pedal is stuck, you should:
column4: turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column6: hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it. If not, shift into neutral and use the brake to slow your vehicle and get off the road.
column8: ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: try pumping it to increase pressure.

column2: 20. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.
column8: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column10: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 21. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column6: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column8: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.

column2: 22. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
23. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.
column8: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column10: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 24. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.

column2: 25. The term "No-Zone" is used to describe:
column4: a school zone where standard vehicles cannot enter.
column8: the blind spots around a truck or bus.
column10: a railroad crossing with no signals.
